expected_failures.reason: File contains invalid content type for PNG extension. The file uses 'application/vnd.ms-package.3dmanufacturing-3dmodeltexture' as the content type for a PNG file, but per 3MF specification, texture content types must be 'image/png' or 'image/jpeg'. This is error E2004 in the parser. This appears to be an error in the official test suite.

File contains a build item transform matrix with zero determinant (0.000000), indicating a singular (non-invertible) transformation. Build item 0 has transform [0 0.6667 -0.3333 1 -0.6667 0.3333 1 0.6667 -0.3333 65.101 80.1025 110.1]. Per 3MF spec, transform matrices must be valid and non-degenerate. The file appears to be non-compliant with the core specification requirement for valid transformations.

File contains a build item transform matrix with zero determinant (0.000000), indicating a singular (non-invertible) transformation. Build item 0 has transform [0.0001 0 0 0 0.0001 0 0 0 0.0001 50 50 50]. Per 3MF spec, transform matrices must be valid and non-degenerate. The file appears to be non-compliant with the core specification requirement for valid transformations.

Build transform bounds validation. The file tests for objects exceeding Y and Z dimensions beyond a specific limit. However, the 3MF specification does not define a universal maximum build volume size, only that coordinates must be non-negative. Implementation validates the spec requirement (non-negative coordinates) but not arbitrary dimension limits.

Build transform bounds validation. The file tests for objects exceeding X dimension beyond a specific limit. However, the 3MF specification does not define a universal maximum build volume size, only that coordinates must be non-negative. Implementation validates the spec requirement (non-negative coordinates) but not arbitrary dimension limits.

Build transform bounds validation. The file tests for negative coordinates (below build plate). However, the 3MF specification allows negative coordinates for centering objects. The test case appears to be testing a constraint that is not part of the core 3MF specification.

File is incorrect per official test suite. It declares production extension as required but the build element does not have a UUID attribute, which is mandatory when using the production extension. Suite 9 tests core extensions, but this file appears to have been mistakenly included or represents a known issue in the official test suite.
